text: Grobnik () is a village in the Istria County, Croatia. Administratively it belongs to the municipality of Pićan. Originally an Istro-Romanian village, the last speaker of the language in the village, Liberat Pahor, died in 1998. == Population == {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 0.5em auto; text-align: center;" |- ! colspan="16" | Population number according to the census |- | 1857 || 1869 || 1880 || 1890 || 1900 || 1910 || 1931 || 1948 || 1953 || 1961 || 1971 || 1981 || 1991 || 2001 || 2011 |- | 172 || 178 || 132 || 140 || 142 || 128 || 162 || 101 || 91 || 70 || 42 || 32 || 21 || 17 || 15 |- |} == References == == External links == *Official homepage of Pićan *Tourist homepage Category:Populated places in Istria County
title: Grobnik, Istria County
